stem: How long will the troponin levels last following myocardial infarction in a patient with normal renal functions?
disc:
There is a basal level of troponin level due to normal turnover of cardiac muscle.

Following 2-3 hours after myocardial infarction, there is a rise of troponin above the 99th percentile. It reaches a peak around 12-48 hours. Then it will begin to fall to the normal level during the next 4-10 days.

This pattern is important to distinguish from other causes of high troponin.
